# AULIN MK.II SPACE-TO-GROUND SALVAGE VESSEL
[color=#a4885c]Ship Size:[/color] Large
[color=#a4885c]Recommended Crew:[/color] 1-3
[color=#a4885c]Power Gen Type:[/color] Antimatter Engine (AME)
[color=#a4885c]Expeditions:[/color] All
[color=#a4885c]IFF Console:[/color] None
[color=#a4885c]Armaments:[/color] L85 90mm Autocannon x2, L-1 Phalanx x2
"The Aulin Mk.II vessel is a space-to-ground transport shuttle made by Foxton DeLacewing shipyards, capable of doing expeditions, having a sizable salvage bay, and having an artifact research chamber. Made to compete with the SKR Meteor with it's own Heavy Bluespace Engine."
# PREFLIGHT CHECKLIST
## 1. Power supply
## 1.1. Battery units
- Check that the Antimatter Engine (AME) generator is functional (View below.) - Check that the SMES unit is anchored to the floor. - Check that the substation unit is charging. - Check that the Engineering APC unit's Main Breaker is toggled on. - Check that the Server Room APC unit's Main Breaker is toggled on. - Check that the Bridge APC unit's Main Breaker is toggled on.
## 1.2. Antimatter Engine (AME) reactor unit.
- Check that the AME control device is anchored to the floor and connected to a 3x3 containment shielding structure. - Check that the AME control device is connected to the cable terminal of your SMES via HV. - Check the fuel remaining of the generator unit. - Enable Injection. (Note: AMEs automatically generate power equivalent to demand.)
## 2. Atmospherics
## 2.1. Distribution Loop
- Check that both air canisters are anchored to their respective connector ports. - Check that outgoing distribution air pump is ON.
## 2.2. Waste Loop
- Enable external waste loop pump. (Located behind AME.)
## 3. Other checks
- Check that the gyroscope is anchored, powered, and enabled. - Check that the mini gravity generator is anchored, powered, and enabled.
## Sidenotes
* - Aulin vessels come with a CTLA-160 Heavy Bluespace Core rated for a max jump distance of ~25km.
* - Due to lack of plating, the AME is not well protected. Making direct hits to the back of the vessel extremely devastating.
* - Aulin vessels are equipped with a power monitoring computer that can be used to appraise the ship's total power production and consumption. An unmodified Aulin vessel requires ~60 kW of power to remain operational.
* - Due to the lack of power from the ship's retrothrusters, pilots are required to be adept at switching flight modes to prevent accidental collision
